title: Lord, how mysterious are thy ways

verses.text:
Lord, how mysterious are thy ways! How blind are we, how mean our praise!
Thy steps no mortal eyes explore; 'Tis ours to wonder and adore.

I do not ask that I may see
What in the future waits for me;
Let consciousness attend thy word,
And thine shall be the humble praise.

Are darkness and distress my share?
Give me to trust thy guardian care;
Enough for me, if love divine
At length through every trial shall shine.

Yet may my soul desires to know,
Be this my only wish below,
That Christ is mineâ€”that great request,
Grant, bounteous God, and I am blest.

Be this my joy, that evermore
Thou rulest all things at thy will;
Thy sovereign wisdom I adore,
And calmly, sweetly, trust thee still.
